instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 strange charging issue
threads.message: Badly corroded around U7100 and no PPBUS_G3H. Removed the old one, added a few jumper wires and soldered on a new U7100. It now starts and works fine, the problem I'm having now is that it always "detects" a charger even if not connected. It senses wether I'm using a 60W or 85W charger but does not register that I remove it. It charges fine and displays battery status, charge cycles, remaining power and so on. I have tried with another MagSafe/IO board and cable. I have also tried with another battery. Also I have reset the SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 strange charging issue
threads.message: My bad, poor soldering on one of the pins.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 strange charging issue
threads.message: I am kind of curious which pin has to be badly soldered for it to think it is always charging now.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 strange charging issue
threads.message: Of course, it was pin 17 if I remember correctly
